name: UI Dark
description:
Dark UI with rectangular tabs.

Deprecated: I personally don't use this theme anymore and won't continue its maintainance.
additional_info:
Features:
- inverted (dark) main menu
- black navigation- and tabs-bar
- icons clearly visible
- rectangular tabs
- tab-close button only on active tab
- inverted (dark) context menu
- "Plug-in disabled"-notification disabled
- larger textarea in Alert-Notifications

If you have any issues with this style, please open a ticket at https://github.com/NiklasGollenstede/stylish

Update 2015-05-23:
Added opacity of 50% to unloaded tabs.

Update 2015-03-19:
Minor changes to work with Firefox 38 Developer Edition.

Update 2015-01-09:
Firefox 35 comes with native css-filters which are faster, more accurate and shorter than 'old' <svg>-filters. Context menus are now pitch black on light OS themes.

Note:
- this style uses (almost) no "!important" declarations to make it easy to suppress certain rules
- (see update) the <svg> filter used to invert some colours in this script is quite cpu-hungry, winch makes some UI-elements a bit unresponsive on slow devices like tablets/netbooks (don't worry on a desktop or modern notebook)
